feat.value: An old man said, ‘If the souls of men were to go forth from fear, after the resurrection, in the presence of God, the world would die of fear and trembling.
For, what would it be like to see the heavens opening, and God revealing himself in anger and threat
... an army of angels, being without number ...
to cause all of mankind to see these together.
Because of this, it is right for us to think in this way, that if we shall give an account to God daily, we shall be cut off because of what we have done in our daily lives.'
